name: Saints And Sinners Quiz / Test | Thematic Fun | 25 Questions

questions.text: Who is the Patron Saint of travellers?
Name the island off the coast of French Guiana which was formerly a leper colony then a French penal colony from 1895 until 1938.
Name the large breed of dog with a dense red-and-white coat which was formerly used as a rescue dog in mountainous regions.
questions.explanation:
St. Bernard

	So called as they were kept by the monks of the hospice at the Great St. Bernard Pass.

questions.text: This vocal girl group had British Number One Singles with 'Never Ever'(1997), 'Pure Shores'(2000) and 'Black Coffee'(2000) to name a few.

questions.correct: The Good, the Bad and the Ugly
questions.explanation: The Good, the Bad and the Ugly.

questions.text: Name the sports and tourist centre in eastern Switzerland.
Name the savoury of prunes wrapped in bacon slices and served on toast.
questions.explanation:
Devils-on-horseback.

	Angels-on-horseback are a savoury of oysters wrapped in bacon slices and served on toast. Angel's tears is another name for moonflower.

In Norse Mythology, the god of mischief and destruction is
questions.explanation:
Loki.

	In Norse mythology, Hel is the goddess of the dead. Frigg is the wife of Odin also goddess of the heavens and married love. Balder is the son of Frigg and Odin noted for his beauty and sweet nature.
